communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: San Fran VA Budget Docs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Access to the budget information of the San Francisco Veterans Affairs
Healthcare System Facility for fiscal years 2021-2022, 2022-2023, and 2023-
2024, utilizing terminology outlined in the "FY 2024 VA Budget in Brief"
document available on VA's website.

Specifically, I am requesting the following information for each fiscal year
mentioned above:

1. Total Appropriations: - The total budget allocation (obligations and outlays)
for the San Francisco Veterans Affairs Healthcare System Facility.

2. Program Level Detail (broken down by category and itemized as available)
a. Personnel Costs: Including salaries, wages, and related benefits for
employees.
b. Medical Services & Medical Community Care Services: Expenditures
related to medical care services and Medical Community Care services
provided to veterans.
c. Medical Support and Compliance: Costs associated with support services
and compliance efforts within the healthcare facility.
d. Facilities: Expenditures for maintaining and operating healthcare facilities.
e. Information Technology: Costs related to information technology
infrastructure and services.
f. Construction: Expenditures for construction projects within the facility.
g. any and all other appropriate categories

3. Budgetary allocations designated for specific programs or initiatives within
the facility, corresponding to the categories listed in the "FY 2024 VA Budget
DEPARTMENT OF VETERANS AFFAIRS
San Francisco VA Health Care System
4150 Clement Street, Mail Stop 00C/PO
San Francisco, CA 94121
“America is #1-Thanks to our Veterans.”
in Brief" document.

4. Any reports or documents indicating financial performance or budget
adjustments made throughout each fiscal year.

5. Any additional relevant financial information or documents that would
provide insight into the financial operations of the San Francisco Veterans
Affairs Healthcare System Facility during the specified fiscal years, utilizing
the terminology as outlined in the "FY 2024 VA Budget in Brief" document.
(Date Range for Record Search: From 09/01/2020 To 02/06/2024)”

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jasper Craven

title: CPS: Missing Active Transportation Reports, IEPs/504s

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPS: Missing Active Transportation Reports, IEPs/504s
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Similar to information released in FOIA N013951-071923, provide the number of students with IEPs/504s missing active transportation requests on the 15th of each month from January 1, 2023 - December 31, 2023. 

Include the information broken down by network, disability type, and race.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani
